alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 12:04PM AKDT until August 23 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The mainstem Kenai River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding, with the worst conditions expected from the Kenai Lake to Funny River. * WHEN...Until 500 PM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Individuals recreating in the area should be prepared for swift and high water levels. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1151 AM AKDT, River gauge and spotter reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in the mainstem Kenai River. High water levels are ongoing along the Kenai River. - The mainstem Kenai River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding, with the worst conditions expected from the Kenai Lake to Funny River. Water levels are expected to remain high through the week and will be continually reassessed in the coming days. Please stay informed on the situation. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - The high water levels and fast currents could make boating more difficult than normal. Please use caution.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
